reporting-org.narrative: Direction-Générale Coopération au Développement et Aide humanitaire
Directorate-general Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Aid

title.narrative: Amélioration de la santé et les droits sexuels et reproductifs des personnes pauvres et vulnérables, en particulier des femmes et des filles, au Burundi, au Burkina Faso, au Lesotho, au Mozambique, en Tanzanie et en Ouganda (initiative She Decides)

IPPF - Improved sexual and reproductive health and rights of poor and vulnerable people, especially women and girls in Burundi, Burkina Faso, Lesotho, Mozambique, Tanzania and Uganda (She Decides Initiative) 2017

description.narrative: 6,662,278 million SRH services provided  828,788 CYP (10 - 24 years:397,526 and 25 years +: 445,359) provided  15 successful policy initiative changes in support of SRHR  21 CMIS systems revised and updated  29 SRH service delivery strategies for focus populations developed  492 IPPF MA staff members trained in the provision of quality, rights-based SRH service delivery  356 events held to raise community engagement with SRHR IPPF will ensure that quality SRH service delivery continues in six of our national Member Associations (MAs) that have been directly affected by the GGR in the Africa region. IPPF will increase the availability and supply of SRH services and information; improve accessibility to under-served, hard-to-reach groups; enhance quality of care; and strengthen advocacy to uphold rights.

IPPF will ensure that quality SRH service delivery continues in six of our national Member Associations (MAs) that have been directly affected by the GGR in the Africa region. The six MAs are: Association Burkinabé pour le Bien-Etre Familial (ABBEF) Burkina Faso, Association Burundaise pour le Bien-Etre Familial (ABUBEF) Burundi, Lesotho Planned Parenthood Association (LPPA), Associação Moçambicana para Desenvolvimento da Família (AMODEFA) Mozambique, Chama cha Uzazina Malezi Bora Tanzania (UMATI), Tanzania, and Reproductive Health Uganda (RHU). The ultimate outcome of the present initiative is to improve the sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) of poor, socially-excluded and under-served people, especially women, girls and youth, in Burkina Faso, Burundi, Lesotho, Mozambique, Tanzania, and Uganda. IPPF will ensure that quality SRH service delivery continues in six of our national Member Associations (MAs) that have been directly affected by the GGR in the Africa region. The six MAs are: Association Burkinabé pour le Bien-Etre Familial (ABBEF) Burkina Faso, Association Burundaise pour le Bien-Etre Familial (ABUBEF) Burundi, Lesotho Planned Parenthood Association (LPPA), Associação Moçambicana para Desenvolvimento da Família (AMODEFA) Mozambique, Chama cha Uzazina Malezi Bora Tanzania (UMATI), Tanzania, and Reproductive Health Uganda (RHU). The ultimate outcome of the present initiative is to improve the sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) of poor, socially-excluded and under-served people, especially women, girls and youth, in Burkina Faso, Burundi, Lesotho, Mozambique, Tanzania, and Uganda.
